ENTRY.refkeywords: xspec xscosmo cosmo Hubble cosmological deceleration get_xscosmo
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Set XSPEC cosmology settings (H0, q0, L0)

DESC.PARA: The set_xscosmo command specifies the cosmology settings (H0, q0, L0) used in XSpec models.
The get_xscosmo command returns the current setting.

LIST.ITEM: H0 - the Hubble constant in km/s/Mpc; default is 50
q0 - the deceleration parameter; default is 0.5
L0 - the cosmological constant; default is 0

DESC.PARA: If the cosmological constant is non-zero, then the value of q0 will be ignored and it is assumed that Omega_matter is >= 1-L0.
This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.7 of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.4.
The current cosmology setting is retrieved ("(50.0, 0.5, 0.0)", the default). It is then changed to "100,0,0.7".

BUGS.PARA: For a list of known bugs and issues with the XSPEC models, please visit the XSPEC bugs page.
